tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE planting_schedule (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    crop_name VARCHAR(50),
    planting_date DATE,
    harvest_date DATE,
    temperature_range VARCHAR(20),
    rainfall_amount DECIMAL(5,2),
    soil_ph DECIMAL(3,1)
)

CREATE TABLE PlantingSchedule (
  planting_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  crop_name VARCHAR(255),
  planting_date DATE,
  harvest_date DATE,
  growth_stage VARCHAR(50),
  planting_location VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE CropManagement (
  management_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  crop_name VARCHAR(255),
  management_practice VARCHAR(255),
  management_date DATE,
  success_rate DECIMAL(5,2)
);

CREATE TABLE weather_data (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    date DATE,
    temperature FLOAT,
    humidity FLOAT,
    precipitation FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE Weather_Data (
    data_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    temperature DECIMAL(5,2) NOT NULL,
    humidity DECIMAL(5,2) NOT NULL,
    observation_date DATE NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE Planting_Schedule (
    schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    crop_id INT NOT NULL,
    planting_date DATE NOT NULL,
    recommended_soil_type VARCHAR(255),
    CONSTRAINT fk_crop_id FOREIGN KEY (crop_id) REFERENCES Crop_Mix(crop_id)
);

CREATE TABLE planting_schedule (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  crop_name TEXT,
  planting_date DATE,
  harvesting_date DATE,
  optimal_temperature FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE weather_data (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  date DATE,
  temperature FLOAT,
  humidity FLOAT,
  precipitation FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE crop_details (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  crop_name TEXT,
  planting_depth FLOAT,
  optimal_ph FLOAT,
  growth_period INT
)

CREATE TABLE field_maintenance (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  field_id TEXT,
  fertilization_date DATE,
  irrigation_schedule TEXT,
  pest_control TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE harvest_records (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  crop_name TEXT,
  harvest_date DATE,
  yield FLOAT,
  quality_rating INT
)
